stage_description:
In this stage, we will calibrate the normalised ablation data. This is done by creating a calibration curve for each element, based on SRMs measured throughout your analysis session, and a table of known SRM values. There are several options you can use to change the behaviour of this stage.

To apply them, click on APPLY. To view the calibration lines for each analyte click on Plot in popup.

Drift Correction
Interpolates calibration parameters between SRM measurements.

Force Zero Intercept
Forces the calibration lines through zero (y = mx).

Minimum Points
The minimum number of data points an SRM measurement must have to be included. This value defaults to 10. This value must be an integer.

Standard Materials
A list of SRMs measured throughout the analysis. These are automatically detected by LAtools based on your configuration.


Your data is now background corrected, normalised to an internal standard, and calibrated.
drift_correct_description: <qt/>Whether to interpolate calibration parameters between SRM measurements.
zero_intercept_description: <qt/>Whether to force calibration lines through zero (y = mx) or not (y = mx + c).
n_min_description: <qt/>The minimum number of data points an SRM measurement must have to be included.
srm_button_description: Open the SRM table in a spreadsheet editor
